Before I put forth the best men’s necklaces around, I’d like to be completely transparent. I haven’t always been a fan of chains. I went through a brief obsession with my dad’s vintage gold curb in my teens, but after that I didn’t really start wearing them again until my mid twenties.

Now? I never take mine off. In fact, you’ll often find me wearing more than one.

A key addition to a guy’s daily rotation, the humble necklace is the perfect finishing touch to any ensemble. Whether you’re a lover of pearls or have an eye for gold, there’s no better way to release your inner badass.

Join me as I highlight every option worthy of your consideration for the best men’s necklaces and help you understand why I’m now a fan for life.

Key Takeaways

My list of the best men’s necklaces awaits. But, before you read on, I’d like to tell you how I decided what to include. To start, I rounded up the pieces I already own—adding them to a list of various other options found by poring over hundreds of photos, customer reviews, and recommendations from various jewelry experts in the industry.

After narrowing them down to 10 standout styles, I was left with a selection of seriously impressive necklaces, including Oliver Cabell’s cuban design and the ultra-affordable curb chain from Miabella.


Best Overall: Oliver Cabell 2mm Cuban Chain

Why it’s great: Understated yet classy, this small cuban chain has been handcrafted using 18K gold that’s been bonded to the brand’s standard base metal. A highly versatile piece, it’ll quietly complement your outfits instead of stealing the show.

Water-, sweat-, and heat-resistant, it can be worn on holiday (in or out of the pool) and will hang neatly on your chest thanks to the 22” length.

How to wear it: This isn’t one of the best men’s necklaces by chance. What I love about it most is that you can wear it pretty much anywhere. It’ll look just as good with a fitted T-shirt and tailored slacks as it will with a sporty sweatshirt and dad jeans.

Who is this for? Anyone looking for a real gold chain that isn’t expensive or showy. You’ll love this if you’re after a simple necklace that adds a touch of luxury to a wide range of outfits.

Flaws but not deal-breakers: It’s going to feel quite small compared to some of the others on this list, but I think that’s part of its charm. Having said that, you could always layer it with various other chains for a bit more impact.

Material: Metal, Gold | Length: 22“ | Colors: Gold | Clasp: Lobster | Style: Cuban | Care: Mild soapy water

Best Everyday: Roderer Lorenzo Necklace

Why it’s great: Bringing a touch of military-inspired style to your everyday fits is always a good idea. Which is why I think Roderer’s Lorenzo necklace is a great companion for your daily escapes.

`It’s handmade from brushed stainless steel and comes with an engraved tag pendant that can be taken off should you feel your outfit would look better without it.

How to wear it: With the pendant, it’ll work well with all of your casual outfits—from sweaters and shorts to flannel shirts and jeans. However, should you want to up the formality, remove the tag and it’ll instantly feel smarter.

Who is this for? Stainless steel is low maintenance, so this necklace requires minimal care to maintain its appearance (making it a practical and cost-effective choice for everyday wear). Plus, the addition of the pendant makes it a great option for guys who want to give their outfits a bit more character.

Flaws but not deal-breakers: It’s going to feel slightly heavier than men’s necklaces made from materials such as silver or titanium. This might make it slightly uncomfortable for some individuals—particularly if you prefer lightweight jewelry.

Why it’s great: If it’s a simple yet effective gold chain you’ve been after, you’re in luck. Oliver Cabell’s necklace goes with just about anything—boasting a classic 5mm cuban link design that’ll never fall out of favor. The lobster clasp fastening ensures that it stays securely shut.

How to wear it: Great news: this necklace will work with literally anything, making it very cost-effective, especially if you wear it every day. Simply get dressed and this will provide the perfect finishing touch.

Who is this for? Warren Buffett might not like gold, but don’t let that put you off. This necklace is an excellent all-rounder and it’s going to be a fine option for guys of all sartorial preferences.

Length

Pay attention to the length of the necklace. Different lengths can convey different styles and may complement different necklines. Try to choose a length that sits comfortably and compliments your physique and style. You should also make sure that the necklace fits well around your neck. It shouldn’t be too tight or too loose.

Versatility

Think about whether the necklace is versatile enough to complement various outfits. This is particularly important if you’re working with a tight budget. A versatile piece can be worn casually or dressed up, providing more value for your investment. Generally speaking, neutral colors and simple designs tend to make the best men’s necklaces.
